title: MacCap readies hammer in BGC Contracting auction
text:
It's mining services companies at 10 paces as the auction for Perth-based mining and construction contractor BGC Contracting goes down to the short strokes.

Street Talk understands that in the red corner is equipment leasing company Emeco, which rents a lot of kit to BGC Contracting and is thinking about vertical integration.

And in the blue corner is fellow listed company NRW Holdings, which made $1.13 billion revenue last financial year shifting rocks and isn't afraid of making acquisitions.

It is understood auctioneer Macquarie Capital is seeking final proposals later this week in an effort to have a signed deal by the end of the month.

BGC Group founder Len Buckeridge:: NRW Holdings is one of two listed Australian companies circling the contracting arm of BGC. Photo: John Mokrzycki

Both companies are understood to have potential issues with their offers - and BGC, like most vendors, has made it very clear that price and certainty of completion are two very important factors.
